Posts.Content: gogo_xago wrote: I feel so bad and the last days but I know why. This week is my mom 6 month check up. She started yesterday and she will finish all the test by the end of this week.  I feel horrible and so nervous. I feel like I'm "freezing" and breathless.  I'd like to say that I'm the only child, my mom is divorced from when I was 3yo. Now I'm pregnant in my first baby, and I know I should be very happy, but my mother's situation "overshadows" my happyness.  I can't share my fears and feelings with anybody because nobody can't understand me. I'm on psychotherapy for the last two years and my psychologist told me that I I live the my mother issue as being mine.  I know that only you here can understand me. Just want to share with you my feelings. Thank you all. You are my friends!!!  hugs Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2010 04:23AM gogo_xago wrote: My mom had 3 rounds of Taxol, two weeks apart. She had problems with hands and feet from neuropathy. The nurse had said to us that Taxol is a cousin of Taxorete. But I don't know the difference. As I remember the onc. doc. had said that if my mom could'n stand of Taxol maybe she would change with Taxorete, but also said the she preferred to continue with Taxol. So my mom had patience and completed the 3 rounds of Taxol. Now about 3 months from the last Taxol she had little numbness in her fingertips but nothing serious. Only doctors can explain the difference between these two drugs and decides which is suitable for you. hugs and kisses 2U and 2 your baby.

Posts.Content: gogo_xago wrote: Tonight I'm going to have the results of CT scan of my mom's first check, after 4 months of chemo. At 10/27 the chemos end and now we are waiting for the results. This is the first time (after diagnosis) we are waiting for results and as time goes by, our anxiety is too high. I know it's quite uncommon to have "bad" news so soon but I feel horrible (and I know mom is feeling worst than me). I'm wondering: Is our lives will be as before diagnosis? I know, never will be the same, but I can't handle it right now. Every time from now on will be so difficult for us?  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: gogo_xago wrote: This is about my mother 64 y.o. Diagnosis July 1st 2009, surgery July 7. 2.2 cm lump, grade 2, HER2 neg, ER - PR pos., lymph nodes 6 positive (from 9), no mets. She started chemo at August 7.  3x3 rounds (totally 9 chemo every 15 days). First round (3 chemos) Ellence (epirubicin), second round (3 chemos) Taxol, and finally third round (3 last chemos) CMF. After all onc. said that she will need radiation (but we don't know how many). Is anybody here familiar with this kind of chemo kind? I mean that I usually find 6 or 8 chemo (after 21 days) but I can't find somebody has 9 chemo like my mother... Please advise...  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: gogo_xago wrote: I have so much to tell you but the language is a problem. I'll try but forgive for my mistakes. This week is my mom 6 months tests. Since last week I'm thinking on it and my stress is getting bigger and bigger. I can't  enjoy anything, I can't eat, I don't sleep well etc. Is it normal? Remember: it's not me who have bc… but feel like it is.  I don't want to discuss my fears with anybody. I don't have brothers or sisters and I don't have my father too. So I feel alone. In these boards I found all you and you are the only ones that you can understand me. Everyday I read your posts and pray you all of you.
